metadata.title: Digital SAT Math Practice – Hybrid Conversion (Modules 1 & 2)
metadata.directions: Answer each question. Select the best choice for multiple‑choice questions or enter your answer for student‑produced response questions. Unless otherwise indicated, figures are not necessarily drawn to scale.

questions.prompt: The graph of the linear function \( f \) is shown, where \( y = f(x) \). What is the y‑intercept of the graph of \( f \)?
questions.rationale: From the graph, the line crosses the y‑axis at \( -4 \), so the y‑intercept is \( (0,\,-4) \).

questions.prompt:
Each rock in a collection of \( 70 \) rocks was classified as either igneous, metamorphic, or sedimentary, as shown in the frequency table.
ClassificationFrequency
igneous\( 10 \)
metamorphic\( 38 \)
sedimentary\( 22 \)

If one of these rocks is selected at random, what is the probability of selecting a rock that is igneous?

Each side of square \( A \) has a length of \( 13 \) inches. Each side of square \( A \) is multiplied by a scale factor of \( 3 \) to create square \( B \). What is the length, in inches, of each side of square \( B \)?

The function \( f(x)=\tfrac{1}{9}(x-6)^2+3 \) gives a toy car’s height above the ground, in inches, \( x \) seconds after it started moving on an elevated track, where \( 0 \le x \le 10 \). Which of the following is the best interpretation of the vertex of the graph of \( y=f(x) \) in the \( xy \)-plane?
choices: The toy car’s minimum height was \( 3 \) inches above the ground.
The toy car’s minimum height was \( 6 \) inches above the ground.
The toy car’s height was \( 3 \) inches above the ground when it started moving.
The toy car’s height was \( 6 \) inches above the ground when it started moving.
questions.rationale: Vertex \( (6,\,3) \) indicates the minimum height is \( 3 \) inches.

questions.prompt: If \( 3x = 8 \), what is the value of \( 21x \)?

A car travels at a speed of at least \( 25 \) miles per hour but no more than \( 50 \) miles per hour for a certain part of a trip. Which inequality represents this situation, where \( x \) is the speed of the car, in miles per hour, on this part of the trip?
questions.rationale: The speed is bounded below and above: \( 25 \le x \le 50 \).

questions.prompt:
A list of \( 10 \) data values is shown:
\( 10,\,14,\,22,\,6,\,24,\,26,\,14,\,8,\,8,\,8 \)
What is the mean of these data?
The function \( f(x)=7x+3 \) gives the estimated height, in feet, of a willow tree \( x \) years after it was first measured. Which statement is the best interpretation of \( 3 \) in this context?
choices: The tree will be measured each year for \( 3 \) years.
The tree is estimated to grow to a maximum height of \( 3 \) feet.
The estimated height of the tree increased by \( 3 \) feet each year.
The estimated height of the tree was \( 3 \) feet when it was first measured.
questions.rationale: Constant term is the initial value at \( x=0 \).

questions.prompt: Which expression is equivalent to \( 2x^3 + 8x^2y + xy^2 + 4y^3 \)?
For the function \( f(x)=x^2+8x+17 \), the graph of \( y=f(x) \) in the \( xy \)-plane passes through the point \( (0,\,b) \). What is the value of \( b \)?

Scientists collected fallen acorns that each housed a colony of an ant species. For any of these colonies, if the colony has \( x \) worker ants, the equation \( y = 0.67x + 2.6 \), where \( 20 \le x \le 110 \), gives the predicted number of larvae \( y \) in the colony. If one of these colonies has \( 35 \) worker ants, which of the following is closest to the predicted number of larvae in the colony?

The given equation relates the positive numbers \( b \), \( x \), and \( y \):
\( b-49=\tfrac{x}{y} \). Which equation correctly expresses \( x \) in terms of \( b \) and \( y \)?

The solution to the given system of equations is \( (x, y) \). What is the value of \( 24x \)?
\( \begin{aligned} 2y&=5x+16 \\ -2y&=7x-22 \end{aligned} \)

Odalys ordered mulch and river rock, which cost a total of \( \$583 \). The given equation represents the relationship between the number of cubic yards of mulch, \( x \), and the number of tons of river rock, \( y \), Odalys ordered: \( 19.5x + 24.25y = 583 \). How much more, in dollars, does a ton of river rock cost than a cubic yard of mulch?

James purchased a certain baseball card on January \( 1 \). The function \( f(x)=55(1.04)^x \), where \( 0 \le x \le 10 \), gives the predicted value, in dollars, of the baseball card \( x \) years after James purchased it. What is the best interpretation of the statement “\( f(T) \) is approximately equal to \( 72 \)” in this context?
choices: When the baseball card’s predicted value is approximately \( 72 \) dollars, it is \( 7\% \) greater than the predicted value, in dollars, on January \( 1 \) of the previous year.
When the baseball card’s predicted value is approximately \( 72 \) dollars, it is \( 7 \) times the predicted value, in dollars, on January \( 1 \) of the previous year.
From the day James purchased the baseball card to \( T \) years after James purchased the card, its predicted value increased by a total of approximately \( 72 \) dollars.
At \( T \) years after James purchased the baseball card, its predicted value is approximately \( 72 \) dollars.
questions.rationale: By definition, \( f(T) \) is the predicted value at time \( T \).

questions.prompt: At what value of \( z \) does the graph of \( y=z^2+18z-23 \) reach its minimum in the \( xy \)-plane?

The function \( P(t)=260(1.03)^{\tfrac{3}{2}t} \) models the population, in thousands, of a certain city \( t \) years after \( 2009 \). According to the model, the population is predicted to increase by \( r\% \) every \( 8 \) months. What is the value of \( r \)?
questions.rationale: Factor \( 1.03 \) corresponds to a \( 3\% \) increase each \( 8 \) months.

questions.prompt: How many centimeters are equivalent to \( 47 \) meters? \( 1 \) meter \( = 100 \) centimeters.
Circle \( A \) has a radius of \( 3x \) and circle \( B \) has a radius of \( 13x \). The area of circle \( B \) is how many times the area of circle \( A \)?

The graph of a line in the \( xy \)-plane passes through the point \( (1,\,5) \) and crosses the \( x \)-axis at the point \( (9,\,0) \). The line crosses the \( y \)-axis at the point \( (0,\,b) \). What is the value of \( b \)?
If \( \tfrac{2a}{b} = 6.5 \) and \( \tfrac{a}{bn} = 26 \), what is the value of \( n \)?
questions.rationale: From the given relation in the prompt, \( n=4 \).

questions.prompt: For two acute angles, \( \angle Q \) and \( \angle R \), \( \cos(Q)=\sin(R) \). The measures, in degrees, of \( \angle Q \) and \( \angle R \) are \( x+61 \) and \( 4x+4 \), respectively. What is the value of \( x \)?
questions.rationale: For acute angles, \( Q=90^{\circ}-R \). So \( x+61=90-(4x+4) \Rightarrow x=5 \).

questions.prompt: Which expression is equivalent to \( 14(x^2-6) \)?
A scientist analyzed a soil sample with a mass of \( 900 \) grams and determined that it contained \( 189 \) grams of water. What is the percentage of water, by mass, in this soil sample?

At what point \( (x, y) \) do the graphs of the equations in the given system intersect?
\( \begin{aligned} x+5&=11 \\ y&=3x^2+3 \end{aligned} \)
If \( \tfrac{6}{7}p + 42 = 84 \), what is the value of \( 7p \)?
If \( 5(x+4)=4(x+4)+58 \), what is the value of \( x+4 \)?

Circle \( N \) has a radius of \( 6 \) millimeters \( (\text{mm}) \). Circle \( M \) has an area of \( 121\pi\,\text{mm}^2 \). What is the total area, in \( \text{mm}^2 \), of circles \( N \) and \( M \)?
What is the slope of the graph of \( y=\tfrac{1}{2}(27x+12)+7x \) in the \( xy \)-plane?
The function \( f \) is defined by \( f(x)=\dfrac{2^{a+4}}{x^{5}} \), and \( f(a)=-19 \), where \( a \) is a constant. What is the value of \( a \)?
questions.rationale: The given choices are consistent with \( a=-8 \) (best matching the expression’s sign/magnitude).

questions.prompt: A data set of the orbital periods, rounded to the nearest whole number of Earth days, for \( 13 \) of Jupiter’s moons is represented in the dot plot. An additional moon with an orbital period of \( 251 \) days is added to the original data set to create a new data set of \( 14 \) orbital periods. Which statement best compares the mean and the median of the new data set to the mean and median of the original data set?
choices: The mean of the new data set is equal to the mean of the original data set, and the median of the new data set is equal to the median of the original data set.
The mean of the new data set is equal to the mean of the original data set, and the median of the new data set is less than the median of the original data set.
The mean of the new data set is less than the mean of the original data set, and the median of the new data set is less than the median of the original data set.
The mean of the new data set is less than the mean of the original data set, and the median of the new data set is equal to the median of the original data set.
questions.rationale: A single low outlier lowers the mean but typically leaves the median unchanged.

questions.prompt: For the linear function \( p \), \( p(c)=-2 \) (where \( c \) is a constant), \( p(5)=34 \), and the slope of the graph of \( y=p(x) \) in the \( xy \)-plane is \( 6 \). For the linear function \( f \), \( f(c)=-4 \) and \( f(6)=52 \). What is the slope of the graph of \( y=f(x) \) in the \( xy \)-plane?

In the given equation, \( c \) is a constant. The equation has exactly one solution. What is the value of \( c \)?
\( 18x^2-24x+c=0 \)

A conservation specialist hung artificial nesting structures each in the shape of a right rectangular prism for a species of native owl. Each structure has a height of \( 11 \) inches. The length of each structure’s base is \( x \) inches, which is \( 1 \) inch more than the width of the structure’s base. Which function \( V \) gives the volume of each structure, in cubic inches, in terms of the length of the structure’s base?

In the given equation, \( k \) is a constant. The solution to the given equation is \( x=\dfrac{15k}{3} \). What is the value of \( k \)?
\( \dfrac{x^2+1}{x}=k \)
questions.rationale: Substitute \( x=5k \) into \( (x^2+1)/x=k \) to obtain \( k=3 \).

questions.prompt: The function \( f \) is defined by \( f(x)=2^{-3x} \). The function \( g \) is a decreasing linear function. In the \( xy \)-plane, the graphs of \( y=f(x) \) and \( y=g(x) \) intersect at two points, \( (h,\,j) \) and \( (k,\,m) \), where \( j>m \). When \( g(x) < f(x) \), which of the following must also be true?
questions.rationale: Between the intersection points the exponential lies above the decreasing line.

questions.prompt: One gallon of sealant costs \( \$29 \) and will cover \( 300 \) square feet of a surface. A deck has a total surface area of \( q \) square feet. Which equation represents the cost \( c \), in dollars, of the sealant needed to cover the deck twice?

A triangular prism has a height of \( 9 \) centimeters \( (\text{cm}) \) and a volume of \( 234\,\text{cm}^3 \). What is the area, in \( \text{cm}^2 \), of the base of the prism? (The volume of a triangular prism is equal to \( Bh \), where \( B \) is the area of the base and \( h \) is the height of the prism.)
An area of \( 56.00 \) square nautical miles is equivalent to \( k \) square kilometers. To the nearest tenth, what is the value of \( k \)? ( \( 1 \) nautical mile \( = 1.852 \) kilometers )

A circle in the \( xy \)-plane has its center at \( (-7,\,3) \) and has a radius of \( 9 \). An equation of this circle is \( x^2+y^2+ax+by+c=0 \), where \( a \), \( b \), and \( c \) are constants. What is the value of \( c \)?

Consider the system \( \begin{aligned} y&=x-c \\ y&=-4(x-6)^2 \end{aligned} \), where \( c \) is a constant. The system has two distinct real solutions. Which of the following could be the value of \( c \)?
questions.rationale: Two intersections occur when the line passes below the vertex \( (6,\,0) \): need \( 6-c<0 \Rightarrow c>6 \).

questions.prompt:
The functions \( f \) and \( g \) are defined by the equations shown, where \( a \) and \( b \) are integer constants,
\( a < b \) and \( b\le 0 \). If \( y=f(x) \) and \( y=g(x) \) are graphed in the \( xy \)-plane, which of the following equations displays, as a constant or coefficient, the y‑coordinate of the y‑intercept of the graph of the corresponding function?

I. \( f(x)=a(4.2)^{x+b} \)
II. \( g(x)=a(4.2)^{x}+b \)
questions.rationale: For I, the y‑intercept \( f(0)=a(4.2)^b \) is not a displayed constant. For II, the y‑intercept is \( a+b \), not directly a displayed constant or single coefficient.

questions.prompt:
For each real number \( r \), which of the following points lies on the graph of each equation in the \( xy \)-plane for the given system?
\( \begin{aligned} 5x+4y&=3 \\ 15x+12y&=9 \end{aligned} \)
questions.rationale: Solve first equation for \( y \): \( y=-\tfrac{5}{4}x+\tfrac{3}{4} \).

questions.prompt:
In triangle \( ABC \) and triangle \( DEF \), sides \( AB \) and \( DE \) each have a side length of \( 10 \) inches, and angles \( A \) and \( D \) each have an angle measure of \( 40^{\circ} \). Which of the following additional pieces of information is/are sufficient to prove whether triangle \( ABC \) is congruent to triangle \( DEF \)?

I. The measures of angles \( B \) and \( C \) are equal.
II. The lengths of sides \( AC \) and \( DF \) are equal.
III. The lengths of sides \( BC \) and \( EF \) are equal.
choices: I is sufficient, but II and III are not.
II is sufficient, but I and III are not.
III is sufficient, but I and II are not.
II is sufficient and III is sufficient, but I is not.
questions.rationale: Given \( AB \cong DE \) and \( \angle A \cong \angle D \), knowing \( AC \cong DF \) gives SAS congruence.
